author: dgaudet
msg: Back out the "evil hack" portion of Raymond's patch.  In addition to being
an evil hack, it causes memory corruption.  You cannot destroy a #included
subrequest of mod_include... look for all uses of "request_config" in
mod_include, in particular look at the code around the ap_join_pool call.

author: coar
msg: Someone finally stood up and made the ReadmeName and HeaderName
features use subrequests.  Not only that, but they can be
parsed for SSIs too!
Submitted by:	Raymond S Brand <rsbx@rsbx.net>
Reviewed by:	Ken Coar

author: mjc
msg: Update based on May 1999 Netcraft results (now Apache+derivatives are at >60%)

author: coar
msg: ".def" isn't a universally-recognised suffix; versions of
make that don't know about it will think ".def.a" is a target
rather than a rule.
